p:
The immunogenic character of the delNS1 virus had also been explored in the context of potential vaccination agents. In a preclinical study the use of complete or partial NS1 deleted H1N1, H3N2, and H5N1 subtypes as vaccines induced potent T cell and B cell responses, protecting mice and ferrets against influenza A virus challenge
31, 82 . Importantly, the virus did not cause any disease in mice or the primate Macaca mulatta when applied intranasally, corresponding to systemic application
82 . In a phase I clinical trial we evaluated a NS1-deleted H1N1 virus as an intranasal vaccination vector
83 . Another clinical trial conducted a similar study using the H5N1 virus
84 . These vaccine studies are relevant for the development of NS1-deletion viruses as oncolytic agents since they indicated that NS1-deletion viruses are safe in humans and are able to stimulate a potent adaptive immune response at the same time.
